## GAD-7 vs ABQ

When comparing psychological questionnaires like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Antisocial Behaviours Questionnaire (ABQ), researchers may face difficulty in determining question harmonising due to different phrasing or language use. This is where the Harmony tool comes in. Harmony offers the unique capability to analyse and compare items from both these instruments, presenting a percentage match. The aspect of GAD-7 vs ABQ thus becomes more detailed and user-friendly with Harmony. ## Suggestive Use of Harmony in GAD-7 vs ABQ Harmony's innovative application of Natural Language Processing and AI makes the comparison of GAD-7 vs ABQ more efficient and less time-consuming. It also reduces the subjectivity of the process. Researchers can either select instruments from Harmony's extensive database, or upload their own instruments in PDF format through the web interface. Using Harmony therefore facilitates a more systemic, objective comparison of these psychological instruments.

## GAD-7 vs ABQ in Different Languages

Harmony takes the GAD-7 vs ABQ comparison a step further by offering multilingual support. This means, Harmony can effectively compare items not only within the same language but also across different languages. This ensures a broader, more inclusive scope of study comparison and harmonisation. Hence, the GAD-7 vs ABQ comparison will not be restricted to English or any specific language alone but will cover a much wider spectrum, thanks to Harmony.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and ABQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and ABQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just ABQ into Harmony</a> - compare ABQ with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
